sense.name: a whirling, circular motion
sense.examples: The figure skater ended his program with a rapid spin. John put some spin on the cue ball as he made the shot. The game contestant gave the wheel of fortune a spin. The washing machine is on it's spin cycle now.

sense.name: a short drive by vehicle
sense.examples: We took a spin along the coast last night. John took Mary for a spin on his new motorcycle. They enjoyed a morning spin down the country lane on their bicycles.

sense.name: rapid spiral descent of an aircraft
sense.examples: The stunt pilot went into a spin, then pulled out of it and straight into a barrel roll. The test pilot took the plane to 35,000 feet and began an intentional spin.

sense.name: angular momentum of a subatomic particle
sense.examples: Quarks have two spin states, spin up and spin down. Fermions, such as quarks, have half-integer spins. Mesons have integer spins.

sense.name: an intentionally biased presentation, interpretation, of events
sense.examples: Campaign workers are trying to control the negative spin on their candidate. That newspaper has put a favorable spin on the story.

sense.name: have a go at something, take a chance
sense.examples: When John asked Mary out on a date, she decided to give him a spin. Bob decided to give writing a spin and wound up publishing a best seller.
